clinical_study.official_title: Diagnosis and Treatment of Russian Patients With MutYH-associated Polyposis

lead_sponsor.agency: State Scientific Centre of Coloproctology, Russian Federation

clinical_study.source: State Scientific Centre of Coloproctology, Russian Federation

brief_summary.textblock: This is single-center, prospective, non-randomized study

detailed_description.textblock: The study will include patients with more than 3 polyps, without mutations in the APC gene. Using molecular genetic research methods (polymerase chain reaction, SSCP, sequencing by Sanger method) mutations in the MutYH gene will be studied. For all patients with mutations in the MutYH gene, an optimal diagnostic algorithm will be developed. The significance of monoallelic mutations in the MutYH gene will be determined. Clinical monitoring will be defined. Optimal amount of surgical intervention will be suggested.

primary_outcome.measure: Patients with germIine mutations in MutYH
primary_outcome.description: number of patients with monoallelic and biallelic mutations in the MutYH-gene

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients with mutations in the MutYH-gene
arm_group.description: Patients with established diagnosis of MutYH-associated polyposis with monoallelic and biallelic mutations in the MutYH-gene
Patients who did not have colon polyps

intervention.description: Amplification of the examined fragments of the MutYH gene was conducted using the PCR machine TP4-PCR-01-Tertsik (DNA-Technology, Russia) containing 25 μL of the reaction mixture: 0.1-1.0 μg genomic DNA; 0.25 μM of each original oligoprimer; 200 μM of each nucleosidetriphosphate; 1 U Taq polymerase; PCR buffer (500 mM Tris, 500 mM KCl, pH 8.74); 2.5 μL MgCl2 (25 mM)); deionized water; 20-30 μL of mineral oil. For MutYH gene analysis (Transcript ENST00000257430) Primer3 software (http:// frodo.wi.mit.edu/primer3/input.htm) was selected and 16 primer pairs. The variants of the primary structure in the obtained fragments were revealed using SSCP. DNA fragments containing electrophoretically identified variants were sequenced.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. patients with multiple colon polyps (n polyps = 4+)
2. patient consent to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
1. presence of mutations in the APC gene
2. patient's refusal to participate in the study
